programme.title: Barbarians Rising
programme.desc: The rise and fall of the Roman Empire from the perspective of the rebel tribes that brought the Empire to its knees, beginning with the story of Hannibal of Carthage, who built the first great barbarian alliance to defeat Rome before it became unstoppable.

programme.title: Swamp People
programme.desc: Dwaine hits a breaking point, Willie realises he is losing money, Kristi hunts with her son and Glenn fulfils a lifelong dream.

programme.title: Parking Wars
programme.desc: Series following the work of employees at the Philadelphia Parking Authority, who carry out the often unpleasant jobs of handing out fines and impounding vehicles.

programme.title: Parking Wars
programme.desc: Series following the work of employees at the Philadelphia Parking Authority, who carry out the often unpleasant jobs of handing out fines and impounding vehicles.

programme.title: Wicked Tuna
programme.desc: A look back at the best and worst moments from previous series, plus a sneak peek at what's to come in the upcoming fourth season.

programme.title: Wicked Tuna
programme.desc: Documentary following fishing crews in Massachusetts. The fishing season kicks off in Gloucester, where every captain in the fleet wants to land the coveted first catch.

programme.title: Pawn Stars
programme.desc: Corey takes a look at a vintage pinball machine, while Chum is left in charge at his new bar and Rick examines a rare coin, known as a 'king of Morgan dollars', dating from 1895.

programme.title: Pawn Stars
programme.desc: A rare Superman v Muhammad Ali comic book is brought into the shop, and Rick attempts to figure out why all the office phones are broken.

programme.title: Ancient Aliens
programme.desc: Experts visit an ancient fortress in Peru believed to have been built by aliens using tools far more advanced than those thought to have been available to humans at the time.

programme.title: Ancient Aliens
programme.desc: Since 1947, a series of unexplained events and sightings have prompted US government officials to become alien hunters. Theorists offer evidence that similar endeavours were made thousands of years ago.

programme.title: World's Deadliest Weather: Caught on Camera
programme.desc: Devastating floods trap residents in Australia, a base jumper gets stranded in freezing temperatures and a destructive hailstorm batters Texas.

programme.title: Swamp People
programme.desc: Dwaine hits a breaking point, Willie realises he is losing money, Kristi hunts with her son and Glenn fulfils a lifelong dream.

programme.title: American Restoration
programme.desc: Bodie fixes up a 1959 Ford F100 in Los Angeles, while in Michigan, Andy takes an emotional ride restoring a 1940's JC Higgins bike, and Bob's Garage resurrects a 1930's gas pump.

programme.title: Fire Masters: BBQ Wars
programme.desc: The competition is fiery and fierce in the Wildfire Round, the Feast of Fire celebrates the flavours of Hawaii and the chefs re-imagine pantry staples for a shot at the final round.

programme.title: Fire Masters: BBQ Wars
programme.desc: Three chefs are ready to scorch their rivals for a chance to win $10,000. One chef decides to cheese it up a little and the judges feast on Moroccan-inspired dishes in the final.

programme.title: American Restoration
programme.desc: Rick is delighted when a go-kart is brought in to be restored, while Tyler gets carried away in his eagerness to impress his father.

programme.title: American Restoration
programme.desc: Rick and his son compete to see who can restore a vintage scooter the fastest, while the team fixes a vending machine.

programme.title: Storage Wars
programme.sub-title: Storage Wars: Best of Darrell and Brandon
programme.desc: A look at the father and son's greatest successes and biggest failures from their attempts to make a living bidding on the contents of abandoned storage units.

programme.title: Storage Wars
programme.desc: The buyers look for 1970s memorabilia in California, where Barry finds a relic from his past and Darrell discovers a lucrative medical device.

programme.title: Storage Wars
programme.sub-title: It's Bring Your Kids to Work Day
programme.desc: Jarrod and Brandi take their children to an auction during spring break, while Darrell puts his 'Gambler' nickname to the test.

programme.title: Storage Wars
programme.desc: Rene brings his dad to the auction, leading to comical developments, while Ivy goes in big despite carrying an injury.

programme.title: Hardcore Pawn
programme.desc: Seth and his father clash when Les's idea turns dangerous, and Ashley embarks on a new in-house business venture.

programme.title: Hardcore Pawn
programme.desc: Les discovers Seth's master plan for a new business structure at the Gold family pawn shop, leading to a huge stand-off between father and son.

programme.title: Hardcore Pawn
programme.desc: The family decides to hold a father-daughter sales competition after Ashley steals a deal from right under Les's nose.

programme.title: Hardcore Pawn
programme.desc: Seth is angered when Les dismisses the consultant's suggestions about improving business practices. Seth disappears, and his manager fears he may be on the verge of quitting.

programme.title: Pawn Stars
programme.desc: The guys inspect a document signed by one of America's founding fathers and a Rickenbacker electric guitar from the 1930s.

programme.title: Pawn Stars
programme.desc: A customer brings in a ticket to the Beatles' 1966 concert at New York's Shea Stadium, and the team plans a birthday surprise.

programme.title: Pawn Stars
programme.desc: A prop from the movie Cleopatra and a 1922 silver peace dollar make for an interesting day at the Gold and Silver pawn shop.

programme.title: Forged in Fire
programme.desc: Four bladesmiths are tasked to craft a signature blade from a massive piece of lift cable. The final two competitors return home to re-create a sword wielded by some of history's fiercest soldiers - the Two-Handed Landsknecht Sword.

programme.title: Ozzy & Jack's American Road Trip
programme.desc: Birmingham veteran rocker Ozzy Osbourne agrees to go to one of son Jack's favourite cities, providing they are able to secure a tour of the White House.

programme.title: Search for the Lost Giants
programme.desc: Jim and Bill Vieira track promising leads on the Goshen Mystery Tunnel site, and a giant skeleton found in 1849.

programme.title: Barbarians Rising
programme.desc: Rome seeks revenge on the barbarian tribes that fought alongside Hannibal, while the survivors of the rebellion regroup under a new leader - Viriathus.

programme.title: World's Deadliest Weather: Caught on Camera
programme.desc: Devastating floods trap residents in Australia, a base jumper gets stranded in freezing temperatures and a destructive hailstorm batters Texas.

programme.title: Air Crash: Disasters Uncovered
programme.desc: Experts investigate how 80 people died when the Express Samina sank near the Greek island of Paros, and how it hit a rock that rose 25 metres out of the sea.

programme.title: Dave Gorman: Modern Life Is Goodish
programme.desc: Dave Gorman performs another of his witty stand-up shows, looking at 'fun facts', the public's perception of Richard Branson and why David Dickinson must be stopped in his tracks.

programme.title: Alan Davies: As Yet Untitled
programme.desc: David Baddiel joins Alan to relive the glory days of Euro â€˜96, while Sindhu Vee, Elis James and Beattie Edmondson discuss celebrities and B&Bs.

programme.title: Alan Davies: As Yet Untitled
programme.desc: Stand-up comic and QI panellist Alan Davies is joined in conversation by Katy Brand, Ian Stone, Jack Dee and Lou Sanders, as they chat about chocolate, bomb scares and stag nights.

programme.title: The Indestructibles
programme.desc: Multi-terrain board sports push Tim and Gendle to their limits, including high speed slaloms and an attempt at the world's first dry ski loop the loop.

programme.title: Teleshopping
programme.desc: A chance to buy goods from the comfort of home.

programme.title: Teleshopping
programme.desc: A chance to buy goods from the comfort of home.

programme.title: Steve Backshall's Extreme River Challenge
programme.desc: The naturalist travels down the Baliem River in New Guinea from its source to the sea, hoping to encounter the ancient tribes and dangerous wildlife that live long its banks and in the surrounding jungle. He begins his journey inland at Lake Habbema, and braves some of the world's fiercest white water rapids. Along the way, he stays in a village belonging to the Dani tribe and ventures into some previously unexplored caves.

programme.title: Rick Stein: From Venice to Istanbul
programme.desc: The chef continues his journey through Croatia and savours the native oysters of Ston, before crossing the border into Albania, where he is joined by his son Jack and the pair sample local dishes such as chicken jufka and kokoretsi. In his own kitchen on the Greek island of Symi, Rick cooks traditional Albanian dishes, including Lepur Comlek and Tave Kosi.

programme.title: Eat Your Heart Out with Nick Helm
programme.desc: Nick journeys to Berlin to reinvent himself with help from Game of Thrones actress Gemma Whelan, in a multi-cultural weekend full of Currywurst and Korean barbeques.

programme.title: Eat Your Heart Out with Nick Helm
programme.desc: Nick returns to his family home town of St Albans for waffles with bacon, followed by a visit to his parents' house for his mum's prawn lasagne.

programme.title: Eddie Eats America
programme.desc: Stoke strongman Eddie Hall visits cosmopolitan Queens, NY, to make a solo attempt at a huge Greek kebab banquet, sample the best Chinese dumplings and try his hand at baseball.

programme.title: Top Gear
programme.desc: Jeremy Clarkson, Richard Hammond and James May compare the Mercedes SLS, the Porsche 911 GT3 RS and the Ferrari 458 Italia, as they race against each other in an epic road trip up America's east coast.

programme.title: Border Force: America's Gatekeepers
programme.desc: A man kidnapped and beaten by a Mexican drug cartel flees across the bridge into America. At Progreso International Bridge, a woman is caught hiding anti-anxiety pills in her bra.

programme.title: Drug Wars
programme.desc: DEA agents in St Louis tackle a growing heroin epidemic, one dealer at a time. And St Louis law enforcement pulls out every stop to reverse the city's culture of drugs.

programme.title: Drug Wars
programme.desc: St Louis DEA expands its investigation into a suspected heroin dealer who has so far dodged them at every turn, and young addicts attempt to break their addiction.

programme.title: Storage Hunters
programme.desc: Brandon and Lori discover a flamethrower in a storage unit.

programme.title: Storage Hunters
programme.desc: Brandon bids on a selection of nude photos, but Lori does not believe they have much value.

programme.title: Storage Hunters
programme.desc: Brandon and Lori head to an airport storage and luggage auction to bid for the cast-offs of the rich and famous.

programme.title: Storage Hunters UK
programme.desc: Sean Kelly and the bidders are in Alton, Hampshire, where Linda is concerned that the other bidders are taking advantage of her superior knowledge and her looks. Meanwhile, Boudicca and Heavy D form more than just a business partnership, and Barry impresses with his dainty footwork.

programme.title: Daddy Day Care (2003)
programme.desc: Two unemployed executives decide to open a day-care centre, believing they have found an easy way to make a profit - but instead discover looking after a horde of rampant kids is not as simple as it seems. Family comedy, starring Eddie Murphy, Jeff Garlin, Steve Zahn and Anjelica Huston.

programme.title: Eddie Eats America
programme.desc: In Austin, Eddie Hall takes on Superbike legend Colin 'Texas Tornado' Edwards in a strength vs speed race - and sets his own eating challenge from eight of the city's food trucks.

programme.title: Eddie Eats America
programme.desc: In Manhattan, Eddie Hall goes head to head with long-time rival Brian Shaw, pulling a 23-tonne truck - and attempting the notorious skyscraper 'Monster' sandwich from Sarge's Deli.

programme.title: Top Gear
programme.desc: Freddie Flintoff heads to Iceland to compete in the world's maddest motorsport, while Paddy McGuinness gets to grips with the latest Toyota Supra. Chris Harris investigates the story of the Lotus 79, arguably the most beautiful F1 car of all time.

programme.title: Red Dwarf
programme.desc: The posse meet three cat clerics who worship Lister. Lister vows to help them as they're being hunted by a feral cat leader who wants to wipe out cats who worship anyone but him. Ray Fearon joins the regular cast as the ruthless Rodon, leader of the feral cats, with Tom Bennett, Mandeep Dhillon and Lucy Pearman as the cat clerics.

programme.title: Have I Got a Bit More News for You
programme.sub-title: Have I Got a Bit More Old News for You
programme.desc: Actor Danny Dyer takes over the reins for extended edition of the satirical quiz from November 2018, with comedian Sara Pascoe and tennis coach Judy Murray joining team captains Ian Hislop and Paul Merton to poke fun at the stories making the headlines.

programme.title: QI XL
programme.desc: Extended edition. Panellists Sarah Millican, Eddie Kadi, Noel Fielding and Alan Davies compete, as Stephen Fry mucks about with a messy mixture of M-themed matters. As usual, the host poses questions that are so difficult, points are awarded for the answers he finds most interesting.

programme.title: Live at the Apollo
programme.sub-title: Sean Lock, Romesh Ranganathan, Marcus Brigstocke
programme.desc: Eight Out of 10 Cats star Sean Lock hosts an evening of stand-up at the Apollo in Hammersmith, London, treating the audience to his own brand of humour before introducing routines by grumpy stand-up Romesh Ranganathan and actor and funnyman Marcus Brigstocke.

programme.title: Shipwreck Secrets
programme.desc: The discovery of a 19th-century schooner in Lake Erie off Ohio's coast that could shed light on not just the founding of Ohio, but the settlement of North America itself.

programme.title: A Tale of Two Sisters
programme.desc: The relationships between female historical figures and their sisters, beginning with the story of Amelia Earhart and her sibling and biographer Grace Muriel.

programme.title: History's Greatest Hoaxes
programme.desc: The story of Henri Charrierre's book Papillon, which he claimed was a true account of his time in the Devil's Island penal colony, but was later exposed as fiction.

programme.title: Teleshopping
programme.desc: A chance to buy goods from the comfort of home.

programme.title: A Tale of Two Sisters
programme.desc: The political divide between sisters Jessica and Diane Mitford, one of whom abandoned high society to embrace communism while the other married fascist leader Oswald Mosely.

programme.title: History's Greatest Hoaxes
programme.desc: A famous attempt to fake the missing link between ape and man, which went unquestioned for 40 years with serious consequences for the study of evolution.

programme.title: True Evil: The Making of a Nazi
programme.desc: A profile of Hermann Goering - the dashing, young, down-on-his-luck war veteran who turned into an extravagant, heartless, obese, drug-addled Nazi billionaire.

programme.title: Hunting Down the Nazis
programme.desc: Part one of two. Documentary about Simon Wiesenthal, a survivor of the Holocaust who dedicated his life to tracking down Nazi war criminals who had escaped justice.

programme.title: Hunting Down the Nazis
programme.desc: Part two of two. Documentary about Simon Wiesenthal, a survivor of the Holocaust who dedicated his life to tracking down Nazi war criminals who had escaped justice.

programme.title: The Good Nazi
programme.desc: The story of Major Karl Plagge, a high-ranking Nazi officer who risked his own life to save hundreds of people, in a story reminiscent of Schindler's List.

programme.title: Secrets of the Third Reich
programme.sub-title: Secrets of the Third Reich: The Nazi Gold Train
programme.desc: Part one of two. The search for a missing train containing Nazi treasure, which was believed to have been hidden in the mountains of Poland.

programme.title: Abandoned Engineering
programme.desc: A town in West Virginia that fell victim to the pace of change when steam trains became obsolete and an underground complex in Italy that had been abandoned for nearly 2,000 years.

programme.title: Abandoned Engineering
programme.desc: A ruined compound on the edge of a peninsula in Colombia which was once home to a famous outlaw and the strange towers looming over red-tinted waters in a Portuguese landscape.

programme.title: Abandoned Engineering
programme.desc: A formerly luxurious and strategic mountain-top villa on the island of Rhodes in the Mediterranean that's been ravaged by acts of revenge by locals since 1955.

programme.title: Abandoned Engineering
programme.desc: A strange-looking town with a supernatural atmosphere, a collection of imposing buildings in southern Australia, and the remains of curious-looking basins emerging from the waves.

programme.title: Abandoned Engineering
programme.desc: Ruins from the time before the fall of the Berlin Wall, including a covert Communist base that hid Cold War submarines for Tito and the former HQ of the Soviet Army in East Germany.

programme.title: Abandoned Engineering
programme.desc: A closer look at a sprawling Wild West ghost town that sits peaceful and abandoned in Montana, USA, but is still haunted by tales of murder, corruption and buried treasure.

programme.title: Porridge: Inside Out
programme.desc: The final episode of the series examines life after the prison sitcom, remembering spin-off Going Straight and the untimely death of actor Richard Beckinsale.

programme.title: 'Allo 'Allo!
programme.desc: Hans succeeds in vaulting over the perimeter fence at the POW camp, while Gruber and Helga try to rescue the others.

programme.title: 'Allo 'Allo!
programme.desc: Aided by Gruber, RenÃ© and company dance their way out of the POW camp, while Maria has deposited herself in the mail to escape.

programme.title: 'Allo 'Allo!
programme.sub-title: Good Staff Are Hard to Find
programme.desc: The Resistance provides a waitress to fill the vacancy at Cafe Rene, and the Colonel is joined by an Italian liaison officer. Wartime comedy, starring Gorden Kaye.

programme.title: Auf Wiedersehen, Pet
programme.desc: Dennis does his bit to cement Anglo-German relations by taking Dagmar for a quiet weekend away. Unfortunately for him, Wayne and Barry blunder in at the crucial moment and reduce his planned seduction to a building-site get-together.

programme.title: Auf Wiedersehen, Pet
programme.desc: The lads encounter a fellow Brit while spending a relaxing weekend in the country - but his hunger, exhaustion and evasive behaviour arouse their suspicions. Ray Winstone guests alongside regulars Jimmy Nail, Kevin Whately and Timothy Spall.

programme.title: Secrets of the Solar System
programme.desc: Jupiter is big, very dangerous and has moons as big as planets, but the more we learn we must conclude this giant is less of a planet and more of a failed star.

programme.title: You've Been Framed!
programme.desc: Harry Hill narrates a comical selection of mishaps filmed by viewers, featuring everything from giddy grandmas, cute kids and crazy animals to below-the-belt mishaps, practical jokers and painful-looking accidents.

programme.title: ITV Nightscreen
programme.desc: Text-based information service.

programme.title: Babushka
programme.desc: Game show hosted by Rylan Clark-Neal in which contestants answer questions to get the chance to open a set of giant Russian nesting dolls, with some empty and others containing prizes up to Â£10,000

programme.title: ITV Nightscreen
programme.desc: Text-based information service.

programme.title: Super 4
programme.desc: Animated comedy adventure series featuring a gang of heroes who protect the city of Technopolis and its King Kenric against evil elements.

programme.title: Super 4
programme.desc: Animated comedy adventure series featuring a gang of heroes who protect the city of Technopolis and its King Kenric against evil elements.

programme.title: Robozuna
programme.desc: Children's sci-fi fantasy series about 14-year-old orphan Ariston and his robot Mangle, fighting an evil empire together.

programme.title: Mission Employable
programme.desc: Kids' documentary series looking at what it takes to become a professional at all kinds of exciting jobs. Agent Danny becomes a news photographer and it's his mission to take the perfect photograph to appear in a newspaper..

programme.title: Mr Magoo
programme.desc: Magoo thinks that he is auditioning for a circus troop, but he is actually in a professional wrestling ring, in the middle of a fight!.

programme.title: Mr Magoo
programme.desc: Magoo thinks he is in the subway but actually, he's in a cave. Running into Weasel, he thinks he's lost and decides to help him find his way..

programme.title: Mr Magoo
programme.desc: Fizz has reduced the size of the moon in order to model it in his own image. But Magoo thinks it's a dinosaur egg ready to hatch!.

programme.title: Mighty Mike
programme.desc: It's cold. Mike invites Iris over to warm up over a hot chocolate. The raccoons sneak in the house and damage the Mikkelsen's home Automation Temperature regulator in the process.

programme.title: Mighty Mike
programme.desc: The raccoons steal Iris's favorite toy but accidentally drop it on the terrace during their escape. Mike picks it up while cleaning, thinking it's Fluffys..

programme.title: Mr Bean: The Animated Series
programme.desc: The fur flies when Scrapper is left in Mr Bean's care - and it's not the creepy cat who needs looking after in the end. With the voice of Rowan Atkinson.

programme.title: Ben 10
programme.desc: Ben saves a State University Alumni ribbon cutting ceremony.

programme.title: Martin & Roman's Sunday Best!
programme.desc: Maya Jama, Robert Rinder and Michelle Visage join Martin and Roman Kemp for the Sunday morning entertainment show, featuring music, chat and a host of fun and games.

programme.title: James Martin's Islands to Highlands
programme.desc: James visits the Shetland Islands, an area of natural beauty that he's always wanted to see. He gets to hire a vintage car to explore the area, where he learns about traditional fish salting and cooks a tasty vegetable curry at a local social enterprise project. Later on, James learns all about Shetland community spirit and cake at one of their famous Sunday teas, and finally cooks up a Shetland-inspired paella on a beautiful local beach.

programme.title: John and Lisa's Weekend Kitchen
programme.desc: John Torode and Lisa Faulkner put a fresh spin on some retro favourites. For starters, they prepare mackerel pÃ¢tÃ© and smoked salmon mousse served with pickled cucumber. The main course is chicken kiev with a side of butter bean mash, followed by an arctic roll, a summer cocktail and a jelly dessert.

programme.title: Love Your Garden
programme.desc: Alan Titchmarsh and his team visit Canterbury to help Gurkha Hari Budha Magar, who lost the use of both his legs in Afghanistan in an IED incident. Though Hari thinks nothing of going out of his way to help others, his own garden is a challenge he has to yet to overcome, so the team transform his overlooked plot into a colourful private sanctuary, and there is a surprise appearance by Joanna Lumley.

programme.title: Grow Your Own at Home with Alan Titchmarsh
programme.desc: Alan harvests the first of the radishes he planted as seeds in the first edition of the programme and steps inside his greenhouse to grow an exotic treat or two. Frances Tophill gives a seed-to- plate guide to growing chillies, David Domoney grows barbecue favourites and Katie Rushworth gets healthy with her pick of the best super-foods to grow in even the tiniest of spaces.

programme.title: Britain's Brightest Celebrity Family
programme.desc: Anne Hegerty presents the last heat of the celebrity quiz, a TV Experts special which sees interior designer Laurence Llewelyn-Bowen and Dr Ranj Singh leading their families in the hope of making it through to the semi-finals. The eventual winners will be handed Â£25,000 for their chosen charity and the coveted title of Britain's Brightest Celebrity Family.

programme.title: The Masked Singer US
programme.desc: More mystery celebrities battle it out in a singing contest while dressed head to toe in elaborate costumes, while a panel of more famous faces tries to guess their identities. Nick Cannon oversees the contest, as mystery singers dressed as Flower, Penguin, Eagle and Fox take to the stage, while panellists Robin Thicke, Jenny McCarthy, Nicole Scherzinger, and regular star of the British spin-off Ken Jeong try to work out who is behind the mask.

programme.title: Dickinson's Real Deal
programme.desc: Coventry in Warwickshire is host to David Dickinson and his dealers. Henry Nicholls turns detective, Fay Rutter bags a Breitling watch, and Alison Chapman is in a fluster with some coins - and their charming seller.

programme.title: Tenable
programme.desc: Quiz hosted by Warwick Davis in which a team of five answers questions about top 10 lists from the realms of pop culture and general knowledge, then tries to score a perfect 10 in the final round to take home the prize money.

programme.title: Alan Carr's Epic Gameshow
programme.desc: The comedian hosts a revival of classic game show Strike It Lucky. Three pairs of players will be choosing the top, middle or bottom as they navigate their way across a sea of screens, trying not to let their greed stop them banking too many prizes, and avoiding the infamous hotspots. One lucky pair will reach the endgame, where they stand to win a mountain of prizes and a luxury holiday to Las Vegas.

programme.title: Tipping Point: Lucky Stars
programme.desc: Coronation Street's Jack P Shepherd (David Platt), Strictly Come Dancing judge Len Goodman, and actress and presenter Liza Tarbuck join Ben Shephard to take part in a special edition of the quiz show. All three contestants answer questions to win turns on an arcade-style machine, into which they drop tokens in the hope to knock piles of them off a moving shelf. The more tokens they manage to collect, the better their chances of collecting the Â£20,000 prize for their selected charity.

programme.title: The Chase Celebrity Special
programme.desc: Bradley Walsh presents as Good Morning Britain's Ranvir Singh, journalist John Sergeant, ex-rugby international Ugo Monye and TV presenter Mariella Frostrup pit their wits against ruthless quiz genius the Chaser in the hope of winning a potential prize pot worth thousands of pounds. They must work as a team and play strategically to answer general knowledge questions against the clock and race down the game board to the exit without being caught.

programme.title: Tomb Raider (2018)
programme.desc: After her father's disappearance, kickboxing heiress Lara Croft makes money as a motorcycle courier and refuses to claim her inheritance, convinced her dad is still alive. But when she learns the country estate could be sold off unless she claims it, she reluctantly agrees - and finds a pre-recorded message from her father giving clues to his possible whereabouts. Determined to find him, she sets out across the sea to Hong Kong - but soon crosses paths with a small army of mercenaries determined to break into a supposedly haunted tomb. Action adventure based on the video game, starring Alicia Vikander, Dominic West, Walton Goggins and Kristin Scott Thomas.

programme.title: Cilla: The Lost Tapes
programme.desc: Following her death, Cilla Black's family found a stash of films and behind-the-scenes footage from her personal video collection, along with hours of audio recording of Cilla telling her life story. Narrated by Sheridan Smith, this documentary includes interviews with the family and friends who knew Cilla best, as they watch the lost footage for the first time and recall their memories of a TV icon.

programme.title: Last Laugh in Vegas
programme.desc: Comedians Cannon and Ball, Bernie Clifton, Kenny Lynch and Mick Miller, join forces with musicians Bobby Crush, Jess Conrad, Anita Harris and actress Su Pollard to stage their dream gig in Nevada. For two weeks they'll live together, explore the city and rehearse with Las Vegas producer Frank Marino, preparing for the biggest performance of their lives in one of the area's most iconic theatres.

programme.desc: Non-stop hits to see you all the way through the night.

programme.title: Jungle Gold
programme.desc: With their excavator back, the duo only have 48 hours left to prove that they can get to the gold or their mining deal with Dave Thomas will be terminated.

programme.title: Secrets of the Underground
programme.desc: A legendary train filled with stolen Nazi gold is said to be hidden in Poland. Rob and Stefan explore deep under the earth's surface to uncover the truth.

programme.title: American Chopper
programme.desc: A look behind the scenes of the bike-building show, with a tour around the shop and OCC store, featuring interviews with crew members.

programme.title: Flying Wild Alaska
programme.desc: Luke Hickerson brings Wainwright its first cash machine, Erik Snuggerud races to deliver passengers and supplies before a storm hits and two pilots try to deliver a drill.

programme.title: Dirty Jobs
programme.desc: Mike Rowe joins a crew of high-rise window washers and hopes to control his fear while sitting on a small seat 400ft above street level.

programme.title: How It's Made
programme.desc: An insight into the processes involved in making horseshoes, dishwashers, graphite fly-fishing rods and frozen pizzas.

programme.title: How It's Made
programme.desc: The processes used to make pistons, paint rollers, parachutes and chimneys, and how these methods have evolved over the years with advances in technology.

programme.title: Outback Pilots
programme.desc: Father-and-son mustering team Grant and Matt clash with some tough cattle - and each other. Pilots Alex and Mick battle strong winds and high voltage power-lines.

programme.title: Salvage Hunters - Best Buys
programme.desc: Experienced salvage hunter Drew Pritchard looks back at some of the most memorable finds and interesting characters he's encountered while hunting for items for his shop in Conwy.

programme.title: Chasing Classic Cars
programme.desc: Wayne brings a rare 1946 Volkswagen Type 11 Beetle along with the notorious BMC Technical Support Bus to an auction. Later, a cherry 1979 Super Beetle comes in.

programme.title: Chasing Classic Cars
programme.desc: Wayne chases an AC Bristol and a 1956 Porsche Speedster that's been with its owner for more than 55 years. Later, he brings a 1960 190 SL Mercedes to auction.

programme.title: Wheeler Dealers
programme.desc: Mike Brewer and Ant Anstead answer questions from fans across the globe, revealing the inner workings of the series as they look back at the last eight cars.

programme.title: EFL on Quest
programme.desc: A round-up of goals and highlights from the English Football League, including Huddersfield Town v Wigan Athletic, Hull City v Charlton Athletic, and Reading v Stoke City.

programme.title: Wheeler Dealers: Stripped Down
programme.desc: Mike Brewer sources a VW 181 Thing from a collector, but is unable to haggle the price down. After Edd China gives it a badly needed refurb, it remains unclear whether the duo will manage to make a profit.

programme.title: The Repair Shop
programme.desc: The team restore a clock made from the propeller of a First World War plane, a pair of stained glass windows, and an ancient shoe-stretching machine.

programme.title: The Repair Shop
programme.desc: The team works to restore a clapping monkey toy, an ornate Victorian travelling treasure box, and an iconic 1950s Wurlitzer jukebox.

programme.title: The Repair Shop
programme.desc: Restorers get to work on a grandfather clock, hoping to make it chime again, and doctors perform surgery on a teddy bear with only one ear and one arm after a run-in with a puppy.

programme.title: The Repair Shop
programme.desc: Steven Fletcher tackles an intricate Boulle-work clock that has not ticked for more than 15 years, and soft toy restorers Julie Tatchell and Amanda Middleditch take on a threadbare wheeled elephant. Woodwork specialist William Kirk gets to grips with one of the show's oldest assignments in the form of a 300-year-old Georgian desk that is showing its age.

programme.title: Born Mucky: Life on the Farm
programme.desc: Documentary capturing the reality of life for modern British farmers, exploring the resilience and commitment required to keep farms thriving. A potent pest threatens crops on Tom's farm. Ally tries to save his soya crop from hungry pigeons, while in Shropshire, Ian has inventive plans to improve his rescue pigs' lives.

programme.title: Border Control: Spain
programme.desc: In La Linea, a car hiding contraband cigarettes is stopped at the checkpoint with Gibraltar. Plus, at the port of Barcelona, one phone call sets off a major drug bust. Series following the interventions of Spain's Security and Customs Services at the nation's borders to combat the constant threat from drugs, weapons and suspected terrorists.

programme.title: Border Control: Spain
programme.desc: A grisly arrival at Madrid Airport shocks even the most hardened Civil Guards. A passenger suitcase carrying suspect packets cause a stir in Barcelona Airport.

programme.title: Chasing Classic Cars
programme.desc: Wayne brings a rare 1946 Volkswagen Type 11 Beetle along with the notorious BMC Technical Support Bus to an auction. Later, a cherry 1979 Super Beetle comes in.

programme.title: Chasing Classic Cars
programme.desc: Wayne chases an AC Bristol and a 1956 Porsche Speedster that's been with its owner for more than 55 years. Later, he brings a 1960 190 SL Mercedes to auction.

programme.title: Plane Reclaimers
programme.desc: Three airbuses come in from a recently defunct Lithuanian airline. The arrivals mean the team is handed the daunting task of taking off an engine worth up to $6,000,000

programme.title: Salvage Hunters
programme.desc: Modern day treasure hunter Drew Pritchard scours a Surrey sculpture park, where a pair of rare 18th-century church lych-gates catches his eye. In London, he visits a small showroom with big character.

programme.title: Salvage Hunters
programme.desc: In Sheffield, Drew Pritchard finds a stunning collection of antique cutler's stools. Later, he heads to Leeds where he finds some rare streetlights at a heritage railway and museum.

programme.title: The Repair Shop
programme.desc: The team restores a painting of a wintry Parisian scene, a complicated barometer clock, and a treasured children's tricycle.

programme.title: Salvage Hunters - Best Buys
programme.desc: Experienced salvage hunter Drew Pritchard looks back at some of the most memorable finds and interesting characters he's encountered while hunting for items for his shop in Conwy.

programme.title: Nasa's Unexplained Files
programme.desc: Following Nasa's discovery that something strange is on Saturn's largest moon, experts investigate the possibility of alien life feeding on electric atmosphere.

programme.title: Mummies Unwrapped
programme.desc: A missing mummified body could re-write the history of Abraham Lincoln's assassination, as Ramy Romany investigates whether John Wilkes Booth actually escaped.

programme.title: Forensic Detectives
programme.desc: Investigators search in abandoned cars and shallow graves to unearth vital pieces of evidence that criminals believe are safely hidden.

programme.title: Murder on CCTV
programme.desc: The case of University of Florida student Christian Aguilar, who vanished from his campus in September 2012. Police were stumped until CCTV footage took the case in a shocking new direction, helping lead them to the 18-year-old's body.

programme.title: Murder Comes to Town
programme.desc: The case of Timothy Moore, whose body was found in a shallow grave in April 2011, five months after he had been reported missing from his home in Washington's Willapa Bay. His son Devon later pleaded guilty to his murder.

programme.title: FBI Files
programme.desc: The Safe Streets Task Force monitor the violent acts of a notorious gang of hoodlums who have acquired a reputation for antisocial behaviour.

programme.title: Animal Cops San Francisco
programme.desc: Examining the work of animal police in the city of San Francisco. Scott rescues a dehydrated pit bull puppy that was left muzzled and chained in the back of a hot car.

programme.title: Bondi Vet
programme.desc: Dr Chris is reunited with an old friend, Pluto the singing dalmatian. Plus, cocker spaniel Dusty needs radical ear surgery.

programme.title: Say Yes to the Dress: Bridesmaids
programme.sub-title: Jump for Joy with Your Country Cousins
programme.desc: A bride refuses to pick a dress unless her whole family agrees on it. Plus, another bride tries to find a dress that satisfies both her fiance and sister.

programme.title: Say Yes to the Dress: Atlanta
programme.desc: LeighAnn eyes a figure flattering gown, but her father cannot stand to see his little girl looking all grown up. The staff set out to find a dress that pleases both.

programme.title: Say Yes to the Dress: Atlanta
programme.desc: Taylor shares her appointment with her recently separated parents, who reject each other's wedding dress selections.

programme.title: Bondi Vet
programme.desc: Two boxer puppies are found wandering the streets, and Dr Chris Brown tries to save one after it is hit by a car and begins to cough up blood.

programme.title: Bondi Vet
programme.desc: Dr Chris Brown and the team hope a miniature horse suffering from dwarfism disease will survive another major operation.

programme.title: Bondi Vet
programme.desc: Two girls wait anxiously as Dr Chris Brown works to save their rabbit.

programme.title: Bondi Vet
programme.desc: An Australian kelpie is brought to the surgery after a knock to its head causes severe difficulties with balancing, and a brain scan reveals the problems are inoperable.

programme.title: My 600lb Life: Where Are They Now?
programme.desc: Steven's addictions spiral and a risky decision is needed to save his life. As brother Justin accepts help, Dr Now tries to find the root of their issues.

programme.title: My 600lb Life
programme.desc: Janine's extreme obesity has left her nearly immobile, meaning she must overcome both her physical and emotional pain if she's ever going to live a normal life again..

programme.title: Disappeared
programme.desc: The case of Sherrill Levitt, Suzie Streeter and Stacy McCall who vanished from their home in Springfield, Missouri, in June 1992. Sherrill was Suzie's mother, while Stacy was her friend and the disappearance happened a day after Suzie and Stacy had graduated from high school.

programme.title: Say Yes to the Dress: UK
programme.desc: A make-up artist wants a vampire-themed dress, and a woman with a tomboyish dress sense looks for something more feminine to wear on her big day.

programme.title: Say Yes to the Dress: UK
programme.desc: A bride's sister hates every dress she tries on, while another customer is racing against the clock to find a gown - but her own sibling is getting bored of shopping.

programme.title: Say Yes to the Dress
programme.desc: Sarah has come to the salon with her heart set on a particular lace dress, Erika arrives for her third fitting and Kelly is certain she wants one specific dress.

programme.title: Say Yes to the Dress
programme.desc: Consultant Jessica has her hands full with a bride-to-be who has obsessive-compulsive disorder.

programme.title: Say Yes to the Dress
programme.desc: Sarah and her husband visit the salon to find a gown for their 10th anniversary vow renewal, while Jodee wants to look sexy on her wedding day.

programme.title: Say Yes to the Dress
programme.desc: Having beaten cancer, Kristin is ready to marry her high-school sweetheart, while Latoya wants a ball gown with plenty of bling.

programme.title: Say Yes to the Dress
programme.desc: Former pageant consultant and part-time model Ashely dreams of a gown she tried on at a different salon.

programme.title: Say Yes to the Dress
programme.desc: Bride-to-be Candice is shopping with her mother, with three weeks to go until her wedding, while Jacy arrives at the salon with an entourage.

programme.title: Long Island Medium
programme.desc: Victoria claims she is allergic to gluten, but Theresa thinks her daughter is being overly dramatic.

programme.title: Long Island Medium
programme.desc: Theresa discovers her son wants to get his motorcycle licence, and in a group reading a woman hears details from a harrowing incident in her past.

programme.title: How to Look Good Naked
programme.desc: Gok Wan helps Jade and her aunt Sadie rebuild their body confidence after battling cancer, setting out a radical agenda to get them loving themselves again.

programme.title: Hoarding: Buried Alive
programme.desc: Featuring a woman whose house is so full of belongings that she has to use a local health club to shower.

programme.title: Born to Kill?
programme.desc: Documentary examining the crimes of Ted Bundy, who is believed to have sexually assaulted and killed up to 100 women in 1970s America.

programme.title: My 3000lb Family
programme.desc: Ed's daughters express their concerns ahead of his surgery. Meanwhile, the family unites to support Amy on her tough road to recovery.

programme.title: The World's Fattest Man - A Love Story
programme.desc: The former 'World's Fattest Man' Paul Mason seeks a surgeon to remove the excess skin after his 700lbs weight loss. As he struggles through his weight-loss journey, he finds love.

programme.title: Forensic Detectives
programme.desc: Forensic detectives demonstrate how killers who spill even a drop of blood always run the risk of leaving themselves open to identification. Plus, an incident involving a woman struck by a train.
